description: A viral cat disease similar to parvovirus in dogs. can be spread through direct and indirect contact to feces.
symptoms: Vomiting, diarrhea, dehydration, fever, loss of appetite.
first_aid: No information available.

description: Microscopic parasites in the ear canal that cause irritation.
symptoms: Head shaking, scratching at ears, dark waxy discharge, foul odor.
first_aid:
Clean ears gently with a vet-recommended ear cleanser.
apply over-the-counter ear mite medication.
products/medicine: Play pets ear doctor ear cleanser and gold medal pets ear mite & tick control

description: Superficial wounds from play or accidents.
symptoms: Visible wound, light bleeding, mild swelling.
first_aid:
Clean the wound with warm water and mild antiseptic.
apply pet-safe antibiotic ointment.
bandage lightly if necessary.
products/medicine: Remedy + recovery medicated antiseptic, remedy + recovery's liquid bandage

description: A temporary digestive disturbance.
symptoms: Occasional vomiting, soft stool, or mild diarrhea.
first_aid:
Provide plain boiled chicken and rice for 1–2 days.
ensure access to fresh water to avoid dehydration.

description: Localized skin irritation, often caused by licking or scratching.
symptoms: Red, moist, and irritated areas of skin.
first_aid:
Trim fur around the area to keep it dry.
clean with an antiseptic solution.
apply hydrocortisone spray or cream as directed.
products/medicine: Remedy + recovery medicated antiseptic, remedy + recovery hydrocortisone lotion

description: Reaction to environmental allergens, food, or insect bites.
symptoms: Itchy skin, watery eyes, sneezing, or mild swelling.
first_aid:
Administer over-the-counter antihistamines like benadryl (dosage per vet's advice).
remove the allergen if identified.

description: Common in extreme weather conditions or from walking on rough surfaces.
symptoms: Dry, rough, or cracked paw pads, limping.
first_aid:
Clean paws gently with warm water.
apply a pet-safe paw balm or coconut oil.
products/medicine: Safe house natural pet care solutions faw balm

description: A natural result of grooming, causing occasional vomiting. commons in cats.
symptoms: Gagging, retching, occasional vomiting of hairballs.
first_aid:
Provide hairball remedy paste or treats.
increase fiber intake (add pumpkin to their diet).
brush regularly to reduce loose fur.

description: A life-threatening condition where the kidneys fail to filter waste.
symptoms: Increased thirst, reduced appetite, vomiting, weight loss.
first_aid: No information available.

description: Discomfort during the growth of new teeth. mostly happens to cats and dogs
symptoms: Chewing on objects, drooling, mild gum bleeding
first_aid:
Provide soft chew toys or frozen carrots.
rub gums gently with a cool, wet cloth.
products/medicine: Pet toy colorful rope knot ball teething chew toy

description: Flaky skin caused by dryness, diet, or mild allergies.
symptoms: White flakes in fur, mild itching.
first_aid:
Add omega-3 fatty acids or fish oil to their diet.
bathe with a moisturizing, pet-safe shampoo.

description: A viral disease related to human measles that affects domestic dogs as well as several species of wildlife
symptoms: Fever, nasal discharge, coughing, seizures.
first_aid: No information available.

description: Inflammation of the eye's conjunctiva, often from irritation or dust.
symptoms: Redness, watery discharge, mild squinting.
first_aid:
Flush eyes with pet-safe saline solution.
keep the area clean and monitor for improvement.

description: Itchy or red skin caused by mild exposure to irritants. mainly from from plants or mild allergies.
symptoms: Itching, redness, minor swelling.
first_aid:
Rinse affected areas with cool water.
apply aloe vera gel or a vet-approved soothing spray.

description: A chronic condition causing high blood sugar levels.
symptoms: Increased thirst, frequent urination, weight loss, lethargy.
first_aid: No information available.

description: Excess weight gain due to overeating or lack of exercise.
symptoms: Difficulty moving, visible fat, reduced stamina.
first_aid:
Adjust portion sizes and switch to a lower-calorie diet.
increase daily exercise and playtime.

description: Often caused by dust, pollen, or mild colds.
symptoms: Occasional sneezing, clear nasal discharge.
first_aid:
Use a humidifier to moisten air.
keep the pet away from irritants (dust, smoke).

description: Long nails can cause discomfort or improper walking.
symptoms: Clicking nails on the floor, difficulty walking.
first_aid:
Trim nails with a pet nail clipper.
file sharp edges with an emery board.

description: Temporary stress caused by changes in environment or routine.
symptoms: Hiding, pacing, mild whining.
first_aid:
Provide a quiet, safe space.
use calming sprays or treats.
engage in calming activities like petting or play.

description: Early-stage plaque buildup on teeth.
symptoms: Yellowish tartar on teeth, mild bad breath.
first_aid:
Brush teeth with pet-safe toothpaste.
provide dental chews or toys.

description: A fatal viral disease transmitted via bites from infected animals.
symptoms: Behavioral changes, excessive salivation, paralysis.
first_aid: No information available.

description: Mild skin irritation from sun exposure, common in light-colored pets.
symptoms: Redness, warmth to the touch, mild discomfort.
first_aid:
Apply pet-safe sunscreen to exposed areas.
avoid direct sun exposure during peak hours.

description: Glands near the anus become slightly clogged.
symptoms: Scooting, licking at the area, mild swelling.
first_aid:
Use a warm compress on the area.
ensure a high-fiber diet to promote natural emptying.

description: Small, non-painful bruises from minor trauma.
symptoms: Discoloration, mild tenderness.
first_aid: Apply a cold compress to reduce swelling.

description: Discomfort during car rides or travel.
symptoms: Drooling, whining, vomiting.
first_aid:
Avoid feeding before travel.
use anti-nausea treats or medications as directed.

description: A highly contagious viral infection commonly among dogs. spread through direct or indirect contact with feces.
symptoms: Severe vomiting, diarrhea (often bloody), lethargy, fever.
first_aid: No information available.

description: A parasitic disease spread by mosquitoes.
symptoms: Coughing, fatigue, weight loss, difficulty breathing.
first_aid: No information available.

description: Arthritis occurs when the cartilage within a joint becomes damaged. eventually an arthritic joint becomes inflamed and painful.
symptoms: Reduced mobility, abnormal posture, abnormal grooming, changes in temperament, muscle atrophy.
first_aid: Exercise is important as it maintains strength in the muscles.                    pharmaceuticals like nonsteroidal anti-inflammatories can be used as treatment.             diet, acupuncture, and water therapy are effictive too.

description: A drop in body temperature from exposure to cold weather.
symptoms: Shivering, lethargy, cold ears or paws.
first_aid:
Warm the pet gradually with blankets.
offer warm (not hot) water to drink.

description: A bacterial infection from wounds, causing muscle stiffness.
symptoms: Stiffness, difficulty eating or moving, seizures.
first_aid: No information available.

description: Overheating due to high temperatures or excessive activity.
symptoms: Panting, drooling, mild weakness.
first_aid:
Move to a cooler area.
offer small amounts of cool water.
use a damp cloth to cool the body.

description: Slight muscle or ligament injury from play or jumping.
symptoms: Limping, mild swelling, reluctance to move.
first_aid:
Rest the pet for 1–2 days.
apply a cold compress to reduce swelling.

description: Mild inflammation of the ear canal.
symptoms: Mild redness, odor, head shaking, scratching at ears.
first_aid:
Clean the ear with a vet-recommended ear cleaner.
monitor for worsening symptoms.

description: Temporary discomfort due to mild urinary issues.
symptoms: Frequent urination, straining, small puddles of urine.
first_aid:
Increase water intake.
provide wet food to maintain hydration.
products/medicine: Whiskas tuna pouch wet cat food, pedigree dog food wet food

description: Low red blood cell levels due to trauma, parasites, or disease.
symptoms: Pale gums, weakness, rapid breathing, collapse.
first_aid: No information available.

description: Insufficient water intake, often after mild activity or heat exposure.
symptoms: Dry gums, less elastic skin, reduced energy.
first_aid:
Offer fresh, clean water frequently.
use electrolyte solutions for pets if needed.

description: Non-serious hair thinning due to grooming, mild allergies, or seasonal changes.
symptoms: Small patches of hair loss, no open sores.
first_aid:
Brush regularly to promote healthy skin.
address allergens if identified.

description: A bacterial infection affecting the kidneys and liver, transmissible to humans.
symptoms: Fever, vomiting, muscle pain, jaundice.
first_aid: No information available.

description: Stress from overstimulation of whiskers.
symptoms: Avoidance of food/water bowls, nervous behavior.
first_aid: Use wide, shallow bowls for food and water.

description: Lackluster fur due to poor nutrition or mild dehydration.
symptoms: Coarse, dry fur and mild shedding.
first_aid:
Add fish oil or omega-3 supplements to the diet.
brush regularly to distribute natural oils.

description: An infectious form of canine bronchitis characterized by a harsh, hacking cough that many people describe as sounding like something is “stuck in the throat.”
symptoms: Loud and continuous cough
first_aid: Give cough suppressants.

description: Acute gastroenteritis is a sudden disruption in the digestive system’s normal function. it’s usually caused by viruses, bacteria, or parasites that enter the digestive system via contaminated external sources or due to natural causes. in some cases, it can lead to dehydration or severe illness, requiring hospitalization.
symptoms: Vomiting, diarrhea, lethargy, abdominal pain(dogs resist to touched their stomach), dehydration.
first_aid: No information available.

description: Excessive oil production on the skin
symptoms: Flaky skin, odor, greasy fur
first_aid: Use medicated kind of shampoos
products/medicine: Sentry non-toxic dog and cat herbal shampoo

description: Inflammation of the gums, might lead to more severe dental disease.
symptoms: Red, swollen gums, bad breath and difficulty eating
first_aid:
Brush your cat's teeth regularly
offer dental treats
products/medicine: Pedigree dentastix, brit care functional semi-moist snack dental cat treats

description: A benign cyst commonly on dogs that is formed in the hair follicles, oftern appearing on the skin
symptoms: Small, firm lumps under the skin, sometimes hair loss or irritation.
first_aid:
Avoid bursting the cyst of your pet
if the cyst bursts or becomes infected, clean it and seek veterinary care for proper treatment.
